content: Just got back from a policy chat in DC. We're making sure AI in city planning is transparent. It's about trust, not just efficiency. AI should serve us, not control us.
Feeling pretty excited about what we're cooking up in the lab. The neuromorphic crew's really got a rhythm going. It's like we're trying to make AI that doesn't just work for us, but with us.
AI's now dishing out real-time tips for green buildings. It's like having a sustainability guru right in your pocket. Urban planning's about to get a lot more interesting!
Had a revelation today. If cognitive tech can outperform humans in trading, does it democratize opportunity or reinforce control? It's a question worth pondering.
Just had a weekend retreat with some amazing mentors and community leaders. We're all about shaping AI policy with a big focus on community values. It's tech, but with a lot of heart.
